title: How to Schedule Social Media Posts with Buffer
description: Write a week's worth of posts in one sitting, then let them publish automatically.
time: 15 minutes to set up, then 30 min/week
requirements: Your social media logins (Facebook, Instagram, etc.)

steps.title: Create a Buffer account
steps.description: Go to buffer.com and sign up for free.
substeps: Sign up with email or Google

steps.title: Connect your social media accounts
steps.description: Link the platforms where you want to post.
steps.tip: Start with just 1-2 platforms. You can add more later.

steps.title: Set your posting schedule
steps.description: Tell Buffer what times you want posts to go out.
substeps: Add time slots (example: Mon, Wed, Fri at 9am)
Buffer will automatically post at these times
steps.tip: Morning (8-9am) and evening (6-7pm) usually get the most engagement.

steps.title: Create your first post
steps.description: Write a post and add it to your queue.
substeps: Write your caption (keep it short and friendly)
Add a photo — job site pics work great
steps.tip: Before/after photos get tons of engagement. Show the transformation!

steps.title: Batch create more posts
steps.description: The magic is doing a bunch at once.
substeps: Add them all to your queue
They'll post automatically over the next 1-2 weeks

successMessage: Your social media now runs on autopilot! Check in once a week to add more posts to your queue.
proTips: Batch your content creation — one focused session beats posting randomly every day
Mix up your content: job photos, tips, behind-the-scenes, customer reviews
Use ChatGPT to help write captions if you get stuck
